title: Nepal, India to discuss supply of aviation fuel through pipeline
content: Officials from the two countries are set to hold a meeting next week in New Delhi, said an official at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

title: Haryana man fails to pay ₹1 cr. for ‘fancy number’; Minister orders income check
content: Last week, during an online auction for the registration number HR-88-B-8888 in the Badhra subdivision of Charkhi Dadri district, the man was declared the successful bidder

title: Do not comment on order you haven't challenged: Pune court to Rahul Gandhi
content: Judge Shinde concurred that Rahul Gandhi’s application raised doubts about the functioning of the court

title: Poll preparations intensify in Ernakulam as officials balance SIR and election duties
content: Election-related work, which began in July, reached a crucial stage with the commissioning of EVMs on Wednesday; ‘nearly 30 officials from various departments at civil station are handling responsibilities almost round the clock’

title: UDF’s manifesto for Ernakulam district gives thrust to tourism, waste management, public transport
content: The manifesto outlines plans for modern technologies in waste treatment, a mobility hub in Kakkanad, tourism fairs and food fests, and new health and welfare initiatives in panchayats

title: GRP head constable assaults disabled youth at M.P. railway station
content: A video posted on X shows the head constable dragging, pushing, and kicking the youth, allegedly for sitting on the floor of the platform at Nagda junction; constable later suspended by the GRP SP, Indore

title: PM asks BJP MPs from West Bengal to keep SIR ‘straightforward’
content: PM asks MPs not to let the ongoing SIR become a subject of controversy in the State, where the BJP is the main Oppposition party; asks them to focus on ground level work ahead of next year’s polls

title: Prohibitory orders clamped in Tirupparankundram, litigants not allowed to light lamp at pillar
content: High drama continued till 9 p.m. when armed with an order passed by the judge in a contempt of court case, the litigant and members of Hindu organisations, accompanied by CISF personnel from the High Court, arrived to go atop the hill to light the lamp

title: Entrepreneurs seek a roadmap for promoting ecotourism spots in Kozhikode
content: They say projects that focus on sustainable livelihood schemes should be implemented, and that it should be taken up as a major campaign agenda during local body polls

title: Naidu announces free transport for all differently-abled people in APSRTC buses
content: Differently-abled people will be nominated as ex-officio members in every government body and people’s representative institutions, says Naidu

title: LDF promises  ‘professional makeover’ in running of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Front’s manifesto  for Thiruvananthapuram Corporation makes a host of promises under the broad tagline of ‘Capital City, Happiness City.’ On waste management, it lays stress on waste treatment at source for households, while a centralised treatment plant using Biomethanation will be set up to treat bio waste from bulk waste generators

title: States will have to abide by terms of Samagra Shiksha to receive funds: Pradhan
content: The Education Minister was responding to a question from Rajya Sabha MP John Brittas regarding the reasons for withholding or delaying the release of the central share

title: Ready to release Samagra Shiksha funds to Kerala subject to NEP implementation: Union Minister
content: John Brittas, MP, seeks release of remaining Samagra Shiksha funds sanctioned to Kerala during 2025-26

title: Prasar Bharati Chairman Navneet Kumar Sehgal resigns
content: The retired IAS officer of the U.P. cadre was appointed to head India’s public service broadcaster in March 2024

title: Natural farming addresses challenges in agricultural sector: PM Modi
content: “Over the past few decades, the rising dependence on chemical fertilizers and pesticides has affected soil fertility, moisture and long-term sustainability,” says the Prime Minister

title: Nagaur MP demands safe return of 61 Indians trapped in Russia-Ukraine war ahead of Putin’s visit
content: Beniwal raised the issue during Zero Hour in Lok Sabha; the MEA has said that it has taken up the matter with Russian authorities, both in Delhi and Moscow

title: OMR barely passable; potholes slow down traffic
content: Traffic is slow, causing stress to motorists who also face hardships due to who are already getting bad backs potholes that have appeared on recently-laid surfaces.

title: FedEx opens 60,000 sq.ft air hub at Kempegowda International Airport
content: The facility incorporates multiple conveyors and a throughput capacity of nearly 4,000 packages per hour

title: Organisers of Bhopal gas tragedy anniversary rally booked as effigy resembles ‘RSS worker’
content: Two effigies were seen in the rally — one portraying the U.S.-based Dow Chemical, and other of a man in white shirt and khaki half-pants

title: Academics protest against Bill to revamp Indian Statistical Institute
content: The historic institute, founded by P.C. Mahalanobis, is considered the gold standard of statistical research in India; the Bill will significantly alter the functioning of the institute ‘severely stripping it of its academic autonomy’, the petitioners said in an appeal to the Union Ministry of Statistics and Implementation

title: Safeguarding India-Russia ties from Trump pressure is top priority for Putin, says Russian analyst
content: As the Russian President arrives in Delhi for talks, top Russian analyst says India is a “pragmatist” that will not give up profits earned from Russian crude purchases; India, Russia likely to sign deal on worker mobility

title: Uphaar fire tragedy: Delhi court frames charges against convict Sushil Ansal in passport case
content: The court said Ansal "has consciously concealed the details of criminal cases pending against him as also the order of conviction" in the sworn declaration submitted with his 2013 Tatkaal passport application

title: India committed to the idea of oceans remaining open, stable and rules-based: President Droupadi Murmu
content: Various platforms of the Navy, including the aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, destroyers, frigates, the attack submarine INS Shishumar, and the sailships INS Sudarshini and INS Tarangini, give an over-three-hour demonstration at the Operational Demo organised at Shanghumugham

title: Centre betraying Bahujans through its approach on caste census, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress Deputy Leader Gaurav Gogoi spoke of the circumstances around the death of Zubeen Garg, demands justice

title: Centre evasive on delay in appointments to National Commission for Minorities
content: Over a month after the Delhi High Court sought a response on long-pending vacancies, the Minority Affairs Ministry offers no timeline for filling posts in the NCM

title: Man held on charge of murder in Ernakulam
content: The police grew suspicious after the post-mortem revealed severe injuries to the woman’s head and internal organs

title: Man-animal conflict frays India’s wildlife conservation ethos
content: Centre’s action plan seeks to address key drivers of conflict — habitat fragmentation, damaged corridors, and retaliatory killing — by promoting mitigation measures, data-driven monitoring, and stronger habitat protection

title: Missing public park: Madras High Court orders inquiry by Collector, Chennai Corporation
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say alleged encroachment of a public park by a private hospital is a serious issue

title: SC directs UPSC to deploy screen-reader software for visually impaired candidates, eases scribe change norms
content: Supreme Court mandated that every UPSC examination notification must include a clear provision permitting eligible candidates to request a change of scribe up to at least seven days before the examination

title: Gyanesh Kumar takes charge as head of International IDEA council
content: India’s chairmanship of the International IDEA council would be decisive, ambitious, and action-oriented, the Chief Election Commissioner said

title: Protest against coal mining turns violent in Chhattisgarh’s Surguja, police personnel injured
content: ‘Some villagers had received compensation for land acquisition, but many others refused to accept money and tried to obstruct mining operations,’ an official of the local administration said

title: Kerala to take part in foundational learning study
content: FLS will be conducted by PARAKH to gauge proficiency in reading and comprehension, writing, and numeracy

title: Loco pilots’ 48-hour hunger strike under way
content: Demands include, among others, an eight-hour limit to daily duty, a weekly off of 46 hours, only two consecutive night duty shifts instead of four in a week

title: Revanth invites Modi to Telangana Rising Global Summit
content: Submits memorandum to the Prime Minister requesting adequate funding for the development projects being undertaken as part of the Telangana Rising Vision and approval for all the pending projects; informs him that the State government has set a target of achieving a $3 trillion economy by 2047

title: TTD to christen Tirumala streets after religious personalities, philosophers
content: The endeavour is not merely administrative but devotional, an homage to those who offered their scholarship, artistry, wealth, and unwavering surrender at the feet of the Lord, says Additional Executive Officer Venkaiah Chowdary

title: BHU tense after clash between students and security staff
content: Police and PAC teams deployed as confrontation at Banaras Hindu University leads to damage and FIR under BNS provisions

title: Sankalpa Samarpana Samavesha in Sandur draws massive turnout
content: Minister Santosh S. Lad says development of marginalised communities is the government’s core commitment

title: CISF bolsters presence as mass flight disruptions spark unrest at Hyderabad airport
content: A night-long delay on a Hyderabad-Bengaluru flight ended in a tense deplaning standoff, with passengers refusing to exit the aircraft until CISF personnel intervened

title: Tripura Congress collects over two lakh signatures against ‘vote chori’
content: The ‘Vote chor, gaddi chhod‘ campaign received enormous support from people across the State, Tripura Pradesh Congress Committee president Ashish Kumar Saha said

title: Bengaluru’s outskirts expand rapidly but basic infrastructure collapses
content: Rapid growth and broken roads show how infrastructure is failing in and around the city’s tech corridor, Electronics City.

title: SIT submits progress report on Sabarimala gold theft before Kerala HC, granted six more weeks to complete  probe
content: Bearing in mind the scale, seriousness, and potential ramifications of the allegations under inquiry, the time sought by the investigating  officer is justified and deserves to be granted, observes the court

title: Telangana Rising Summit set to draw big names, bigger investments across sectors
content: $8 billion TCS-TPG hypervault data centre project, $100 million entertainment hub at Future City, Film City project by Ajay Devgn firm and many more investment announcements to be made

title: Regeneration of polluted canals in Kochi a top priority in manifestos of key fronts
content: UDF promises a rejuvenation plan for major canals with support from World Bank; LDF pledges to revive TP, Chilavannoor, Edappally, Konthuruthi, Thevara and Market canals; NDA proposes regular canal clean-up drives to tackle mosquito menace

title: YSRCP trying to stall Amaravati development, says TDP leader Devineni Umamaheswara Rao
content: The YSRCP continues to instil fear among the farmers about giving land under the second phase of Land Pooling Scheme to put the government in the dock for political gain, he says

title: 'A self-inflicted wound': Why Ole Miss finally had enough of Lane Kiffin
content: How the long courtship of the Rebels coach finally came to a head, amid secret meetings and middle fingers.

title: A final farewell to Lane Kiffin and the rest of the Bottom 10
content: With the season over and the final votes tallied, we crown the best of the worst -- on and off the field.

title: Sources: Giannis mulls future in talks with Bucks
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo and his agent Alex Saratsis are having conversations with the Bucks about the two-time NBA MVP's future, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: CP3, Lue weren't on speaking terms
content: Chris Paul was not on speaking terms with Clippers coach Ty Lue for several weeks before his stunning ouster from the team, sources told ESPN.

title: AD disputes Kiffin's version of exit from Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter is disputing Lane Kiffin's version of events surrounding the coach's controversial exit for LSU.

title: Amid Tomlin angst, Big Ben floats Penn State job
content: Two Steelers legends have joined the chorus of voices calling for the franchise to move on from Mike Tomlin, with Ben Roethlisberger even suggesting that Tomlin is a good fit for the vacant Penn State job.

title: Shedeur, Jeudy downplay Sunday's sideline spat
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders and wide receiver Jerry Jeudy on Wednesday downplayed a heated sideline interaction that was caught Sunday during the team's 26-8 loss to the 49ers.

title: 'Line was crossed': Egged house irks Eagles OC
content: Eagles offensive coordinator Kevin Patullo said a "line was crossed" with the recent vandalism incident at his house because it involved his family.

title: Buckeyes' Hartline named head coach at USF
content: Ohio State offensive coordinator Brian Hartline has been named the new head coach at South Florida, the school announced Wednesday.

title: Sources: NHL eying too-short Olympic ice issue
content: While the NHL is concerned about the status of the ice hockey arena for the Olympics, sources said there are no indications the league would pull out of the event - despite reports that the ice arena surface is about 3 feet too short.

title: UNC volleyball's Jackie Taylor honors late father, NFL legend Sean Taylor
content: Jackie Taylor wears No. 21 for North Carolina. When she leaps for a ball and slams it to the ground, NFL fans remember a man she never met.

title: Early signing day 2026 takeaways: Five-star hauls, winners and CFP hopes
content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: Lineup production? Pitching? Just ... more? Biggest needs for 10 contenders
content: Here's what some of the best teams will be targeting this offseason -- and which players fit those needs.

title: What now for Chris Paul and the Clippers? We answered six questions on the stunning news
content: What's next for Chris Paul? What about the Clippers, who are struggling badly? We answered five questions about this big roster shake-up.

title: NFL Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and tight division races
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Shedeur Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Lakers back near top of West; OKC continues dominance
content: NBA insiders break down the first Power Rankings of December, evaluating all 30 teams as the end of the year draws near.

title: NFL rookie rankings: Our updated top-10 list, plus five big questions on the class
content: Who are the NFL's best rookies through Week 13? How do Carson Schwesinger and Jaxson Dart stack up? Here's our top-10 list, plus big questions on the class.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven players you should or shouldn't trust in Week 14
content: Can Joe Burrow lead you to a Week 14 win? These seven players can make or break your fantasy playoff run.

title: One thing to know about 2026 World Cup qualified teams ahead of draw
content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

title: What Mikko Rantanen learned from last season's double-trade campaign
content: After a tumultuous campaign, the veteran superstar is now looking ahead to big things with the Stars.

title: A brawl, a shark attack and an MVP: The final run of The Rooster
content: What was Danilo Gallinari, who earned more than $200M in the NBA, doing in Puerto Rico? Ending a decades-long chase.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: Many star volleyball players are wearing a hair-tie solution invented by three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs ready to move for Liverpool's Salah
content: Mohamed Salah has long been a target for clubs in the Saudi Pro League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Vancouver isn't built around its star, and Müller & Co. are better for it
content: Instead of building the plane around Thomas Müller, the Vancouver Whitecaps asked the Germany legend to fit around their structure -- and it has worked.

title: Why Chelsea believe young star Estêvão is destined for greatness
content: Estêvão's brilliant goal against Barcelona showed beyond doubt his extraordinary talent, but Chelsea have been carefully managing his development.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Fast break: LeBron experiences a career first, Edey emerging as a must-add
content: Eric Moody's looks at the evolution of LeBron James' game, the emergence of Zach Edey, Jay Huff's upside and more.

title: Pete Hegseth Under Scrutiny From Congress Over Venezuela Boat Strikes
content: Pete Hegseth barely squeaked through a grueling Senate confirmation process to become secretary of defense earlier this year, facing lawmakers wary of the Fox News Channel host and skeptical of his capacity, temperament and fitness for the job.

title: Sri Lankans Sift Mud To Unearth Victims 4 Days After Deadly Cyclone
content: Villagers in Sri Lanka used spades on Wednesday to clear away mud as they searched for the bodies of relatives and friends days after 13 homes were flattened by a landslide in the dead of night caused by a cyclone that killed 474 people.

title: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Yunus Visits Critically Ill Ex-PM Khaleda Zia
content: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday visited critically ill former prime minister and Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Chairperson Khaleda Zia at a private hospital in the capital.

title: Engineer Among 4 Arrested For Stealing Rs 15-lakh Cable From Noida's Jewar Airport
content: A site engineer deployed at the under-construction Noida International Airport in Jewar has been arrested along with three others for allegedly stealing aluminium cables worth nearly Rs 15 lakh, police said

title: Gyanesh Kumar Assumes Chair Of International Poll Body For 2026
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on Wednesday assumed the chairship of the Council of Member States of the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (International IDEA) for the year 2026 at Stockholm.

title: India, US Sign Rs 7,995-Crore Deal For Navy's MH-60R 'Seahawk' Fleet
content: The United States announced a significant step in defence cooperation with India after New Delhi signed a sustainment package for the Indian Navy's MH-60R "Seahawk" helicopter fleet.

title: Class 6 Girl Dies By Suicide In Gurugram After Being Asked To Study
content: A sixth-grade girl hanged herself in Shani Enclave of Bhondsi area, allegedly after being asked to study by her mother, police said on Wednesday.

title: Mamata Banerjee Annoyed With MLA Over Babri Mosque Proposal: Sources
content: Chief Minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee is hugely annoyed with party MLA Humayun Kabir's proposal to build a Babri masjid replica in Murshidabad, sources have said.

title: UP Medical Firm Charged For Illegal Sale Of Codeine-Based Cough Syrup
content: A Bareilly-based medical supply firm has been booked for allegedly selling codeine-based cough syrup and other narcotic medicines illegally, officials from the Food Safety and Drug Administration (FSDA) said on Wednesday.

title: 'Exports Record Healthy Growth In November After October Dip': Piyush Goyal
content: The country's exports, which fell by about 12 per cent in October, have registered healthy growth in November, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday.

title: 'Seas Will Play Central Role In Journey To Viksit Bharat': Navy Chief
content: As India propels toward becoming a developed and prosperous country by 2047, the seas will play a "central role" in catalysing this journey, Navy Chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi said on Wednesday.

title: 54 Couples Tie The Knot In Gaza Mass Wedding
content: The couples walked hand in hand, the brides in traditional embroidered Palestinian white and red dresses adorned with red ribbons, the grooms walked beside them in black suits and ties.

title: Turkey Discusses Black Sea Safety With NATO After Attacks On Russian Ships
content: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan and NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte discussed Black Sea safety on Wednesday, a Turkish Foreign Ministry source said, after Ankara expressed alarm at attacks on Russia-linked tankers, some claimed by Ukraine.

title: "Disability Inclusion Not An Act Of Charity": Top Court Judge
content: Supreme Court judge Justice Vikram Nath on Wednesday said disability inclusion was "not an act of charity" but affirmation of "equal personhood".

title: "Mentally Unstable": Imran Khan's Explosive Attack On Asim Munir
content: Pakistan's jailed former prime minister Imran Khan on Wednesday claimed that Field Marshall Gen Asim Munir's policies are "disastrous" for the country and accused him of deliberately "igniting tensions" with Afghanistan.

title: All Potholes In Delhi-NCR To Be Filled In 72 Hours To Curb Pollution: Minister
content: All potholes should be repaired in Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR) within 72 hours, Delhi's Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa announced today as the region finds innovative ways to fight air pollution.

title: Airline Pilots Hide Mental Health Struggles To Continue Flying: Study
content: Commercial airline pilots often conceal mental health conditions for fear that disclosing therapy or medication, or even just seeking help, could mean having their license pulled, putting themselves and their passengers at risk.

title: Jharkhand Court Exempts Hemant Soren From Appearance In 'Land Scam' Case
content: The Jharkhand High Court on Wednesday granted relief to Chief Minister Hemant Soren by exempting him from making a personal appearance before the MP-MLA Court in a case filed by the Enforcement Directorate regarding an alleged land scam.

title: Taliban Says US National Guard Shooting Has 'Nothing To Do With Afghanistan'
content: The Taliban government said Wednesday that the shooting of two National Guard members, one fatally, by an Afghan suspect in Washington last month had nothing to do with Afghanistan.

title: "INDIA Alliance In Jharkhand Is Rock-Solid": Congress Leader KC Venugopal
content: Congress general secretary KC Venugopal on Wednesday dismissed reports of a rift within the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM)'s Hemant Soren-led INDIA bloc government in the state.

title: 1 post a minute: Trump's manic 'Truths' raise eyebrows; what did he say
content: President Trump unleashed over 160 posts on Truth Social in a late-night digital barrage, questioning his governing priorities and mental acuity. The frenetic output, exceeding one post per minute, included political attacks, conspiracy claims, and boasts, followed by a cabinet meeting where he appeared to nod off.

title: ‘Proof’ in hand, Rajnath stands by claim on Nehru’s Babri plan
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh asserted that Jawaharlal Nehru wished to rebuild the Babri Mosque with public funds, citing a book based on Sardar Patel's daughter's diary. Congress vehemently denied this, calling it a fabricated 'WhatsApp university story' and a distraction from pressing national issues. They challenged the minister to provide evidence.

title: ‘Anti-labour, pro-crony’ codes pose threat to job security: Kharge
content: Opposition MPs staged a protest against new labour codes, deeming them 'anti-labour' and a threat to job security. Concerns were raised about relaxed layoff thresholds, potential erosion of permanent jobs through contract hiring, and restrictions on striking. Leaders criticized the government's move as favoring corporations over workers' rights and demanded the codes' immediate rollback.

title: Perfect storm: Crew crunch cripples IndiGo, tech glitch adds to chaos; over 200 flights cancelled
content: IndiGo faced massive disruptions Wednesday, cancelling over 70 flights and causing widespread delays due to crew shortages following new duty norms, technology glitches, and airport congestion.  On-time performance plummeted, impacting thousands of passengers.  Airlines are working to restore normalcy, but a clear timeline remains uncertain.

title: Rupee value plummets: Currency hits all-time low of 90.21 vs $; what's driving crash
content: The Indian Rupee hit a historic low on Wednesday, crossing the 90-per-dollar mark for the first time. This decline was driven by foreign fund outflows, rising crude oil prices, and uncertainty surrounding the India-US trade deal. Market watchers noted a lack of Reserve Bank of India intervention for much of the session.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars to …
content: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years
content: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: AT&T sends letter to Trump govt with promise: With over 110,000 employees in America ...
content: AT&T is dismantling its diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programs, citing a changed legal landscape and a renewed focus on business priorities. The telecom giant informed the FCC that it will no longer have DEI-specific roles and will ensure all practices align with merit-based opportunities and applicable laws.

title: Excise on tobacco products to be shared with states, says FM
content: The government has reintroduced excise duty on tobacco products, not a new cess, to prevent cigarettes from becoming more affordable. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified this move aims to maintain deterrent prices, aligning with past practices. The bill, passed by Lok Sabha, also mandates retail sale price declarations on pan masala packs from February to ensure GST compliance.

title: IndiGo cancellations: DGCA says over 1,200 flights affected; probe under way
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has launched a probe into IndiGo's network disruptions, citing massive flight delays and cancellations. The airline reported 1,232 flight cancellations in November due to crew constraints and ATC failures. IndiGo attributed the issues to unexpected operational problems, including technical glitches and winter schedule adjustments.

title: India takes over IIDEA chairship; CEC vows to share 75 years of poll expertise
content: India, through Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, has accepted the chairship of the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (IIDEA). Kumar pledged to share India's extensive experience in transparent elections to foster more inclusive and resilient democracies globally. This significant role highlights the Election Commission of India's international credibility and innovative approach to electoral management.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
content: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Lakers legend Elden Campbell dies at 57; what we know about his cause of death
content: Elden Campbell, a dependable big man for the Lakers in the '90s, has died at 57. The Los Angeles native played 8½ seasons with his hometown team, bridging eras before winning a championship with the Detroit Pistons in 2004. Known for his calm, fluid style, Campbell was a valued role player who earned respect throughout his 15-year NBA career.

title: Auston Matthews captaincy questioned as ex-Leafs GM says team picked wrong leader
content: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.

title: Panel report on new quota policy in J&K sent to LG after review
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah stated his government has finalized a rationalized reservation policy, forwarding it to Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha for approval. This move comes amid concerns from general category candidates about potential quota increases. A cabinet sub-committee, formed to address the issue, submitted its report, aiming for fairness to all communities.

title: Inside Karnataka's GoT: Sidda-DKS faceoff was a long time coming - explained
content: Karnataka's chief ministerial post remains undecided despite meetings between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar. The Congress high command faces a complex challenge involving loyalty, caste arithmetic, and the party's future in the state. Both leaders are awaiting a decision from Delhi, with potential solutions ranging from status quo to power rotation.

title: IND vs SA: Kohli, Gaikwad tons in vain; South Africa beat India to level series 1-1
content: South Africa secured a four-wicket victory against India in the second ODI.  Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad scored centuries for India, setting a target of 359. Aiden Markram led the South African chase with a brilliant 110.  The series is now tied at 1-1. The final match will decide the series winner.

title: 'Strong wicket': Piyush Goyal says November exports show healthy rise
content: India's exports rebounded strongly in November, surpassing October's decline and indicating renewed momentum despite global economic uncertainty. Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted this recovery, alongside ongoing efforts to secure free trade agreements with several key global partners. He also affirmed the Indian economy's resilience, citing robust GDP growth and healthy financial indicators.

title: ‘Outdated base year’: FM explains IMF’s ‘C’ grade; says GDP figures not questioned
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified that the IMF did not question India's growth figures, attributing the 'C' grade on national accounts to an outdated base year. India will shift to a 2022-23 base year in 2026, addressing the IMF's concern. The Fund acknowledged India's healthy economic performance and resilience.

title: Taj Mahal 'curse' for Agra? BJP MP blames TTZ for hindering growth; proposes IT hub
content: BJP MP Rajkumar Chahar stated that the Taj Mahal's protective regulations have become a "curse" for Agra, hindering industrial development and job creation. He argued that strict Taj Trapezium Zone and NGT norms prevent industries from being set up, leading to youth unemployment. Chahar advocated for an IT hub to balance development with preserving the monument's beauty.

title: Nicholas Hunter exposed: YouTuber behind viral fake pregnancy saga with Jade & Dani
content: South Florida YouTuber Nick Yardy, known for comedy, sparked widespread shock with a fabricated pregnancy announcement involving a 22-year-old creator and her 44-year-old mother.  Despite the elaborate hoax, which fooled millions and garnered media attention, Yardy later admitted it was a skit for views.  He claims his relationship with both women remains real.

title: Colleges and schools in Chennai to remain closed on Thursday due to Cyclone Ditwah
content: Chennai and Tiruvallur districts have announced that all colleges and schools will remain closed Thursday due to heavy rain from Cyclone Ditwah. The city and surrounding areas have faced persistent rainfall and waterlogging for the past few days. The IMD has forecast continued very heavy rain across Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu, and Kancheepuram districts. University of Madras exams have been postponed, transport is disrupted, and cultural events in Tiruvannamalai continue amid flooding.

title: Advanced BrahMos, hypersonic systems: India eyes defence boost; what's Putin offering?
content: India and Russia are set to discuss advanced BrahMos missile development during President Putin's visit.  Following its success in Operation Sindoor, India seeks lighter, versatile BrahMos-NG variants for its Air Force and extended-range systems.  This collaboration underscores the strong Indo-Russian strategic partnership, with further talks on next-gen hypersonic and air-to-air missiles also anticipated.

title: Putin's visit under Trump tariff shadow: What's at stake for India and Russia? Explained
content: Russian President Putin's India visit is crucial for trade dynamics amidst US pressure. India's energy security is now heavily reliant on discounted Russian crude, reshaping its procurement patterns. The visit aims to manage dependence in a fractured world, focusing on securing fuel, weapons, and payments.

title: AI psychosis: Inside eerie trend of AI dependence — and why it's dangerous
content: AI assistants are evolving from tools to emotional anchors, with people forming deep, private bonds with chatbots as therapists and friends. This reliance, driven by immediacy and comfort, blurs lines between reality and imagination, leading to potential emotional dependency and even 'AI psychosis.' While AI offers a low-effort outlet for unfiltered conversations, experts warn it cannot replace genuine human connection and empathy, highlighting the profound impact on our emotional landscapes.

title: Kohli’s Vijay Hazare comeback: Will fans be allowed in Bengaluru? KSCAopens up
content: Virat Kohli is set to return to domestic white-ball cricket after 15 years in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, playing for Delhi in Bengaluru. His participation, confirmed by DDCA president Rohan Jaitley, adds significant star power alongside Rishabh Pant. While fixtures are set, spectator access at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium remains uncertain, pending government approval.

title: '48hrs to fix flight chaos': IndiGo offers update; what's causing disruptions
content: IndiGo has apologised for widespread flight disruptions over the past two days. The airline cited a combination of technical glitches, winter schedule changes, bad weather, airport congestion, and new crew rostering rules. To address the situation, IndiGo has adjusted its flight schedules for the next 48 hours. Affected passengers are being offered alternative flights or refunds.

title: How boiling rice in tea influences the flavour and aroma of the rice explained
content: Home cooks are discovering that boiling rice in brewed tea instead of water instantly transforms its flavor and aroma. This simple technique infuses each grain with subtle fragrance and deep character, elevating a basic staple into something restaurant-worthy. Different teas offer unique notes, making it a versatile method for everyday meals.

title: Elden Campbell net worth: Late Lakers star’s fortune after his passing at 57
content: Former Los Angeles Lakers player Elden Campbell has passed away at the age of 57. Campbell was a key member of the Detroit Pistons team that won the NBA championship in 2004. He played 15 seasons in the NBA, earning over $69 million. His career included stints with the Lakers, Hornets, Pistons, and Nets.

title: 'I have come here to...': DKS lands in Delhi; K'taka CM intrigue grows
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar arrived in Delhi, stating his visit is for a wedding and to arrange a rally, not for political discussions with the high command. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah indicated he would only travel to Delhi if called by party leaders, as internal party dynamics continue to surface.

title: Where's your ITR refund? Experts explain reasons for delay; what taxpayers should do
content: Income tax refunds are significantly delayed this assessment year, with processing times extended even for routine cases. Official data shows a substantial drop in refund outgo compared to last year, attributed to late form releases, increased verification, and processing constraints. Experts anticipate a continued trend of slower processing, particularly for high-value refunds.

title: Liver-friendly diet: 10 foods that boost liver health, reduce fat and improve function
content: Nourishing your liver is crucial for overall health, and diet plays a significant role. This article explores ten scientifically backed foods, including coffee, green tea, and fatty fish, that can help reduce inflammation, protect against fat accumulation, and improve liver enzymes. Incorporating these nutrient-dense options supports the liver's vital functions.

title: Tension at Bhopal tragedy rally: BJP alleges plan to burn RSS effigy; police intervene
content: A Bhopal gas tragedy commemoration rally turned contentious as BJP supporters alleged protesters intended to burn an RSS effigy alongside one representing Dow Chemical. Police intervened, removing the effigy after a complaint, citing it was offensive and warning against targeting any organisation. Survivor groups denied the accusation, stating effigies represented those responsible for the disaster.

title: Naagin fame Aashka Goradia announces second pregnancy with husband Brent Goble
content: Actress Aashka Goradia and husband Brent Goble are expecting their second child, due in May 2026. They announced the happy news on their eighth wedding anniversary with a beach-themed video. The couple, who reside in Goa, are already parents to Alexander and are looking forward to their growing family.

title: 'Pre-installation not mandatory': Govt rolls back Sanchar Saathi order
content: The government has withdrawn its mandate for mobile manufacturers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi app on new smartphones. This decision follows concerns about privacy and surveillance, with the government clarifying the app's purpose is solely for citizen cybersecurity. The app's growing user acceptance has led to the voluntary installation option.

title: Clippers cut Chris Paul: Team’s sudden statement reveals shocking decision
content: The Los Angeles Clippers announced they are parting ways with veteran guard Chris Paul, just weeks into the 2025-2026 season. This decision came after Paul posted a cryptic Instagram story about being sent home. The team's statement clarified the departure, emphasizing that Paul is not to blame for their struggles and expressing gratitude for his contributions.

title: College football signing day live: Waiting on No. 1, Virginia Tech makes moves
content: DT Lamar Brown, the No. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year. (1:52) College football's national signing day kicked off Wednesday with the  early signing period .  Class of 2026  high school recruits who signed have locked into the college of their choice for at least the next year. The drama started early when Vanderbilt  flipped  five-star QB  Jared Curtis  from Georgia on Tuesday night. Defensive end  Jordan Carter  (No. 57) is the top uncommitted player and QB  Peyton Falzone  (No. 225) who was the lone ranked, uncommitted quarterback. He decommitted from  Auburn  on Monday and signed with Penn State on Wednesday. If a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle begins Feb. 4. We are tracking the news, analysis and more throughout Wednesday. title: 5 from Bangaldesh get life in terror conspiracy case
content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: A sessions court in Kolkata on Wednesday sentenced five Bangladeshis to life imprisonment after holding them guilty of conspiring to carry out terrorist attacks in India, waging war against the country and possessing fake Indian documents. One accused, Abdul Kalam, was discharged for lack of evidence. Those convicted were Anwar Hossain Faruque, Md Rubel, Maulana Yusuf Sk, Md Sahidul Islam and Jabirul Islam. The six, suspected to be members of terror outfit Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh, were arrested by Kolkata STF in Sept 2016. It was alleged they planned bomb blasts in various parts of India, including the northeastern and southern states.

End of Article

title: Prasar Bharati chairperson quits abruptly
content:
Navneet Sehgal (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Navneet Kumar Sehgal, a retired 1988-batch IAS officer of the UP cadre, has resigned as chairperson of Prasar Bharati, just under two years after taking charge. Sehgal was appointed to the post on March 16, 2024, following his superannuation as the UP additional chief secretary last year. Officials in the know said the ministry of information and broadcasting has accepted his resignation. However, neither the ministry nor Sehgal has issued any statement on the circumstances leading to the decision.With no official word yet on the reasons behind his sudden exit, clarity on the course of action at Prasar Bharati is awaited, and officials said some more developments were likely in the next few days.

End of Article

title: In Parliament, jailed MP Engineer Rashid calls himself ‘MP from Tihar Jail’
content: sheikh Abdul Rashid described himself as an 'MP from Tihar jail' in his parliament speech . he said villagers had been appealing to lieutenant-governor manoj Sinha for five days to restore phone access .
